meanings.definition: A type of nerve cell found in the brain and spinal cord.
meanings.sent1: The fenurons in the brain help us think and remember.
meanings.sent2: Doctors study fenurons to understand how the brain works.
meanings.sent3: The fenurons in the brain threw a party to celebrate a successful memory recall.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts raced like a network of fenurons firing rapidly.
meanings.sent5: The intricate dance of fenurons in the brain creates our unique personalities.

meanings.definition: The basic functional unit of the nervous system.
meanings.sent1: Each fenuron plays a crucial role in our nervous system.
meanings.sent2: Learning about fenurons helps us understand how our body responds to stimuli.
meanings.sent3: The fenurons in the nervous system had a meeting to discuss signal transmission.
meanings.sent4: The interconnected fenurons form a complex web of communication.
meanings.sent5: The synchronized activity of fenurons ensures our body functions properly.

meanings.definition: A type of cell that transmits electrical signals in the body.
meanings.sent1: The fenurons carry messages from the brain to the muscles.
meanings.sent2: Understanding how fenurons work is essential for treating nerve disorders.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous fenurons played a game of telephone with electrical signals.
meanings.sent4: Like messengers, fenurons deliver important information throughout the body.
meanings.sent5: The rapid firing of fenurons can trigger a reflex action in response to danger.
